title: Sync is hanging in "syncing devices" stage

milestone.title: 1.25.0 - Alpha
milestone.description:
This release should feature:

- General polish:
  further polish of messaging/communities/onboarding/profile"
  Finish resolving all the issues identified during the Porto Sprint
  Fix the UI polish issues that Pedro and Francesca are going to report against 1.24
  Ensure that joining a community where the "Request to join required" setting is OFF works
  Fix syncing with Desktop bugs

- Get the old wallet operational and initial work related to the new wallet

- Security and privacy
  Allow user to change their password

body:
# Bug Report

![IMAGE 2023-09-08 11:38:38](https://github.com/status-im/status-mobile/assets/4557972/e33cd7e2-9fa4-4dce-b84d-8755144eea26)

## Problem 
Android won't go further after sync with latest desktop RC (0.14.0-rc.4 with go [0.166.6](https://github.com/status-im/status-go/tree/v0.166.6))


#### Expected behavior
can sync 

#### Actual behavior
sync is stuck

### Reproduction

1. Desktop: open Profile > Syncing > setup Syncing > generate QR
2. Android: Sign in > Scan QR

### Additional Information

- Status version: nightly  08.09.23
- Operating System: Android
- Logs: [Status-debug-logs.zip](https://github.com/status-im/status-mobile/files/12558011/Status-debug-logs.zip)



[comment]: # (Please, add logs/notes if necessary)
@churik logs are mostly empty unfortunately, could you please provide them again?
only on Android? @churik
no IOS build for today unfortunately, on yesterday build it is not reproducible

> @churik logs are mostly empty unfortunately, could you please provide them again?

sure, 5 mins
It was reproducible 30 mins ago on 3 different devices - now Sync for some reason is working, checking on other devices. Will keep updated

@qfrank 
So for me it is reproducible when it is first device to sync with.

Logs:
[Status-debug-logs.zip](https://github.com/status-im/status-mobile/files/12558498/Status-debug-logs.zip)

emm.. got something useful this time:
```
09-08 12:31:47.432  6764  6872 I ReactNativeJS: INFO [status-im2.contexts.syncing.events:70] - Initiated local pairing {:response "{\"error\":\"Get \\\"https://192.168.1.132:54494/pairing/challenge\\\": x509: certificate has expired or is not yet valid: current time 2023-09-08T10:31:47Z is before 2023-09-08T10:31:53Z\"}", :event :syncing/input-connection-string-for-bootstrapping}
```
There is slightly difference in seconds with the time between android device and desktop , properbly desktop is more acurrate i guess? @churik cc @Samyoul
@qfrank @Samyoul we should accommodate clock differences, as we can't expect clocks to be always synchronized, so there should be some +/- tolerance
The problem is that the clock difference comes from the TLS library. We could back date the cert. Set the cert time 1 minute in the past.

I have no idea, here and there everything is set automatically based on time zone.

@VolodLytvynenko seems to have another issue, will post here
@Samyoul can we set the notbefore notafter date on the certificate?
Yeah we can. It is easy to do. I sent my message a little early, but we can back date the cert. I added the helpful info later.
easy thing
@qfrank maybe add 1 minute to the before and after time, because we need the cert to be valid for the duration of the timeout period.

The same issue is occurring for me on Android. In my case, after scanning the QR code, the 'Oops, something went wrong' page is displayed, and the syncing process becomes stuck after tapping the 'try again' button

https://github.com/status-im/status-mobile/assets/52490791/291e8c76-71d0-4545-911b-f486c5a93603

### Logs:
[android_logcat.txt](https://github.com/status-im/status-mobile/files/12558692/android_logcat.txt)

### Env: 
Mobile: Last nightly
Desktop: 0.14.0 RC4

> @qfrank maybe add 1 minute to the before and after time, because we need the cert to be valid for the duration of the timeout period.

let me create the PR 🫶

> The same issue is occurring for me on Android. In my case, after scanning the QR code, the 'Oops, something went wrong' page is displayed, and the syncing process becomes stuck after tapping the 'try again' button
>

not the same in technique:
```
13:55:28.191  I  INFO [status-im2.contexts.syncing.events:70] - Initiated local pairing {:response "{\"error\":\"failed to connect to any of given addresses. connecting to 'https://192.168.0.103:53196' failed: dial tcp 192.168.0.103:53196: connect: no route to host; \"}", :event :syncing/input-connection-string-for-bootstrapping}
13:55:28.191  E  failed to connect to any of given addresses. connecting to 'https://192.168.0.103:53196' failed: dial tcp 192.168.0.103:53196: connect: no route to host; 
13:55:28.199  I  INFO [status-im.signals.core:33] - local pairing signal received {:event {:type "connection-error", :error "failed to connect to any of given addresses. connecting to 'https://192.168.0.103:53196' failed: dial tcp 192.168.0.103:53196: connect: no route to host; ", :action 1}}
```
no route to host
@qfrank @Samyoul do we retry connections?

> @qfrank @Samyoul do we retry connections?

no, i can add it
that's something we should do I believe

@qfrank be aware that recently @igor-sirotin changed the code so that the client makes an attempt to access every valid IP address the server device shares.

It may be a good idea to retry the whole list of IP addresses if none succeed, rather than retry the same IP individually. Because there may be a number of IP addresses that the server has shared that the client does not have access to.
